content:
Interesting Microsoft telling you about other applications having their own procedures and me first pointing you to their requirements to connect hey. But they like to deny responsibility.

First you need to make sure your incoming and outgoing server are as shown in this page https://support.microsoft.com/en-au/office/pop-imap-and-smtp-settings-for-outlook-com-d088b986-291d-42b8-9564-9c414e2aa040

Then, if you have to change the server names restart Thunderbird and return to the account settings. Change the authentication method to oauth in the incoming account and the outgoing server (SMTP) entry.

creator: wsmwk

content:
Globálna databáza je indexovací systém umožňujúcí Thunderbirdu vyhľadávať v zprávach. Znovuvytvorenie globálnej databázy preindexuje správy a vizitky z adresára. (Správy z konferencií nie sú indexované.)

Postup znovuvytvorenia globálnej databázy: - Ukončite Thunderbird. - Vyhľadajte vo svojom profile Thunderbirdu súbor global-messages-db.sqlite - Vymažte tento súbor. - Spustite Thunderbird. Automaticky sa začne proces vytvárania indexu. V závislosti na počte správ môže indexácia trvať dosť dlhý čas (cca 5 minút). Počas indexácie môžete Thunderbird používat, iba bude znížený jeho výkon a vyhľadávania prinesú iba čiastočné výsledky, alebo dokonca žiadne. Proces indexácie môžete sledovať v Správcovi aktivít (ponuka Nástroje > Správca činnosti).

= Pokud hledám v nich podle data, je to poměrně pracné a k tomu se mně tady zprávy nezobrazují podle času přijetí nebo odeslání, ale dost na přeskáčku. - stačí kliknúť nad prvým emailom na dlaždicu "Dátum" a odteraz sa vám budú zobrazovať podľa dátumu až dokiaľ to nezmeníte.

content:
Inbox -> Properties -> Repair Folder I tried to solve the problem by the above process. Then, three years of emails from 2021-2024 disappeared.

The most likely cause for the lost messages is anti-virus software corrupting Thunderbird mail files. In the worst case this can result in data loss. Accumulating messages in Inbox significantly increases the risk of mail file corruption. By repairing the folder, Thunderbird attempts to fix the corruption. However, at that point, the damage has already been done, and messages may be lost. Without a recent backup created prior to the corruption lost messages cannot be restored.

To avoid problems in the future:

Create an exception in your anti-virus software for the Thunderbird profile folder, so that the anti-virus real-time scanner will not scan it. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profiles-where-thunderbird-stores-user-data#w_how-to-find-your-profile

Don't let your anti-virus software scan incoming and outgoing messages.

Don't let your anti-virus software scan attachments.

Don't let your anti-virus software intercept your secure connection to the server.

Remove any add-ons your anti-virus software may have installed in Thunderbird.

Keep it working. https://kb.mozillazine.org/Keep_it_working_-_Thunderbird

And last but not least, backup your Thunderbird profile on a regular basis. https://support.mozilla.org/kb/profiles-where-thunderbird-stores-user-data#w_backing-up-a-profile

content:
Right-click the account highlighted in your picture, Subscribe, Refresh, and check the box for Junk (MS accounts use Junk instead of Spam or Bulk).

For the other account, open Account Settings, select the dormant account, then Account Actions at the bottom of the left pane, Remove Account. If Remove Account is greyed out, select another account, then Account Actions, Set as Default, then remove the dormant account.

If you want to keep the dormant mail, first copy it to a subfolder of Local Folders.

content:
The ldif and csv files are address books with the same date, and although both can be imported from Tools/Import, ldif is the native format and easier to import.

The Personal file is an mbox file and Personal.snm is the index, now replaced by an .msf file. Open TB, Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, copy the mbox into Mail/Local Folders, restart TB and find the Personal folder under Local Folders in the Folder Pane.
